Web site develop by Janis Davidsons

I created this webpage to store and reviev my programming studies and progress.
In the beginning it might look weird or unfinished, but as my knowledge grows - webpage will develop.

Below is small experiment, which I made while learned javaScript objects. I made a circle class, from which circle objects are made. Press left mouse button to create more circle instaces from circle function constructor. Random size and color circle will apear on screen where mouse is ponted. Refresh page to clear circles.

I used P5.js library and it`s editor to make this. Make sure to check this out -->p5.js javaScript library
Below is code from this program.

//Array to hold cicle objects let circles = []; //color function constructor let Color = function() { this.r = random(0, 255); this.g = random(0, 255); this.b = random(0, 255); }; //circle function constructor let Circle = function(x, y, size, speedX, speedY, r, g, b) { this.x = x; this.y = y; this.size = size; this.speedX = speedX; this.speedY = speedY; Color.call(this, r, g, b); this.changeSpeed = function() { this.speedX = random(0, 10); this.speedY = random(0, 10); } this.changeDirectionX = function() { this.speedX *= -1; } this.changeDirectionY = function() { this.speedY *= -1; } //function to move circle object on screeen this.moveCircle = () => { this.x += this.speedX this.y += this.speedY; } this.drawObject = () => { fill(this.r, this.g, this.b); circle(this.x, this.y, this.size); } //check if circle has reached end of screen, change move direction. this.changeDirection = () => { if (this.x > width || this.x < 0) { this.changeDirectionX(); } if (this.y > height || this.y < 0) { this.changeDirectionY(); } } } let backgroundColor; //setup function function setup() { Circle.prototype = new Color(); backgroundColor = new Color(); createCanvas(450, 450); //draw random color backscreen on startup background(backgroundColor.r, backgroundColor.g, backgroundColor.b); //create circles instnce on startup for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) { circles[i] = new Circle(random(0, width), random(0, height), random(10, 100), random(-5, 5), random(-5, 5)); } } function draw() { background(backgroundColor.r, backgroundColor.g, backgroundColor.b); for (i = 0; i < circles.length; i++) { circles[i].moveCircle(); circles[i].drawObject(); circles[i].changeDirection(); } } //create circle object on mouse click. function mouseClicked(){ circles.push(new Circle(mouseX, mouseY, random(10, 100), random(-5, 5), random(-5, 5))); }
